abstract: Credit Suisse chief Tidjane Thiam continues almost yearlong effort to move firm off ‘ugly duckling’ trades and towards wealth management; although stock fell 50 percent, Credit Suisse board still backs Thiam’s vision, which follows trend among financial peers to back away from investment banking due to increased regulation and volatile markets; executive's blunt attitude and open contempt for certain types of investing is causing him to butt heads with elite bankers who have dominated company for decades.

headline.print_headline: A Bank Boss Who’s Losing the Bankers
headline.main: Credit Suisse Boss Faces Revolt From Bankers Over Strategy Shift

snippet: A drop in bonuses and a move away from investment banking have led traders to grumble about Tidjane Thiam’s plans for the future of the Swiss bank.
lead_paragraph: A drop in bonuses and a move away from investment banking have led traders to grumble about Tidjane Thiam’s plans for the future of the Swiss bank.
